item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Lanthus20 Lanthus20
item.description:
@Lanthus20 wrote:

your running x64 i assume? theres a fix over in the client section.

saw your above post. To find out 32 or 64 bit go to the start menu and right click on computer and choose properties. under system type it should tell you.

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

Download jdk 18, and replace “start javaw” with “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe”
or if your lazy copy and paste this
@echo off
cd Files
// start www.voteplease.tk
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @chester_1001 chester 1001
item.description:
@chester_1001 wrote:

[quote=“Zanzibar, post:3, topic:329462”][quote author=RyScape link=topic=425850.msg3128030#msg3128030 date=1266186922]
i don’t think you need the // before start. I think you can just put

@echo off cd Files start www.voteplease.tk start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit
[/quote]
// states a comment. If he wanted for the site to pop-up then he would of taken out the //.

@T.O. - It’s either the client, source, or both that is causing the problem.[/quote]
it dont happen to no1 ouse and it happens to me on every server i think its either my java or windows 7

Read full topic

@T.O. - It’s either the client, source, or both that is causing the problem.[/quote]

item.title: Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @chester_1001 chester 1001
item.description:
@chester_1001 wrote:

runs client on windows 7
loads for 10mins then closes all clients. WHY?

@echo off
cd Files
// start www.voteplease.tk
start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

i got jre6

Read full topic
